intro: Garnotia stricta var. stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf garnotia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and wetland restoration projects.
